tweets.text:
We continue to work with partners on a major pumping operation to alleviate flooding in #Malton from surface and groundwater.

We are also monitoring levels on the #RiverDerwent which is due to peak in the early hours of the morning below the flood defence level. https://t.co/JqOt3b6KmD
@foresaken1 @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency Rivers are dredged- the issue is the sheer quantity of crap in them and lack of flood plains. The EU never banned it either.

tweets.text: As water levels have started to recede in the #UpperDon and #UpperRother catchment, we‚Äôve started to inspect some of our reservoirs and check on the assets still operating. https://t.co/O8l82iyH3J

@NFMClo @HardcastleNT @Calderdale @CalderdaleFound @EnvAgencyYNE @2B_Landscape @ScottAPatient @HollyLynch5 Observational only on these particular dams, the photos show slowed flow (not laminar quite, but slowed) up to dam location and then a hydraulic jump back to turbulent flow, there is a backwater effect and water taking up a greater volume in the flood plane than without the dams

tweets.text:
We've been at @HardcastleNT today to have a nosy around after the turbulent few days we've been having weather wise. Check out the tethered leaky dams doing their job of keeping Hebden Bridge dry. We are incredibly pleased to see our work doing a grand job.
#slowtheflow https://t.co/WGLm6eQX6F
And the @EnvAgency forget they where once called the National Rivers Authority ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è https://t.co/x3R8jJcueb

tweets.text:
Here's the latest from #Northwich, where the flood defences are holding river water back. 

There a lot of some surface water around at the moment and we are working closely with @Go_CheshireWest and @Unitedutilities to try and get the water back into the river. https://t.co/fkTYBjr9lB

There are a number of #flood alerts and flood warnings in place across the North West - check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

Our teams continue to monitor the situation and are ready to respond. https://t.co/u9TpFotMXF

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps
